title: Wavelet Quantile Correlation Tutorial
text: Wavelet Quantile Correlation (WQC) powerful tool examining scale-specific dependence two time series different points distribution (e.g., tails median). combining maximal overlap discrete wavelet transform (MODWT) quantile correlation measures, WQC uncovers extreme central co-movements vary across time scales. wqc package implements WQC three user-friendly functions: quantile_correlation_analysis(x, y, quantiles, …): Computes quantile correlations monte-carlo confidence intervals single X-Y pair. apply_quantile_correlation(data, quantiles, …): Applies analysis across single Y variable multiple X variables, returning consolidated data frame pairwise results. plot_quantile_heatmap( df,label_levels,palette,…) : plots estimated quantile correlations heatmap form. significant values bordered white line.

title: Wavelet Quantile Correlation Tutorial
text: Let XX YY two random variables. quantile level τ∈(0,1)\tau\(0,1), define influence function: ϕτ(w)=τ−(w<0), \phi_\tau(w) = \tau - (w < 0), (⋅)(\cdot) indicator function. quantile covariance YY XX τ\tau : qcovτ(Y,X)=Cov(ϕτ(Y−Qτ,Y),X−𝔼[X]), \mathrm{qcov}_\tau(Y,X) = \mathrm{Cov}\bigl(\phi_\tau(Y - Q_{\tau,Y}),\,X - \mathbb{E}[X]\bigr), Qτ,YQ_{\tau,Y} τ\tauth quantile YY. Quantile Correlation (QC) : QCτ(X,Y)=qcovτ(Y,X)Var(ϕτ(Y−Qτ,Y))Var(X). \mathrm{QC}_\tau(X,Y) = \frac{\mathrm{qcov}_\tau(Y,X)}{\sqrt{\mathrm{Var}(\phi_\tau(Y - Q_{\tau,Y}))\,\mathrm{Var}(X)}}.

title: Wavelet Quantile Correlation Tutorial
code: library(wqca) set.seed(123) # Reference series plus two targets data <- data.frame(   x = rnorm(512),   y = 0.6 * rnorm(512) + 0.4 * rnorm(512),   z = rnorm(512) ) quantiles <- c(0.1, 0.5, 0.9) # Compute WQC up to 3 levels with 300 bootstrap sims res_df <- apply_quantile_correlation(data, quantiles, J = 3, n_sim = 300) # View top rows head(res_df)
